Detailed Description

Base Class for Grippers.

The Gripper class is a generic base class for all Gripper classes. It contains functionality to open the gripper, close the gripper and find the state of the gripper. The implementation for a specific gripper is done in a derived class. For example, the DefaultGripper class.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: End Effector Classes 
// Authors:   Vijayakrishna Basettihalli
// Start Date: Fri Jun 08 06:12:46 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: Gripper.t.cpp
// Example program for the class Gripper.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>
#include <conio.h>


// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "Gripper.hpp"
#include "ObjectManager.hpp"


//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{ 
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);

  ObjectManager om;
  Gripper *gripper = om.createDerivedObject<Gripper>();
  
  if (gripper->d_objectStatus.isStatusError()) 
  {
    cout << gripper->d_objectStatus.getMessageText() << endl;
    return -1;
  }
  
  cout << "Menu: " << endl;
  cout << " \t[o]pen" <<endl;
  cout << " \t[c]lose" <<endl;
  cout << " \t[q]uit" <<endl;
  char ch;
  
  while ((ch=getch()) != 'q') 
  {
    if (ch=='o')
      gripper->open();
    else
      if (ch=='c')
        gripper->close();
      
  }
  
  RoboticPlatform::exit();            
  return 0;
}

bool isOpen ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Determines if the gripper is open.

Returns:
true: If the gripper is open.
false: If the gripper is closed.

Reimplemented in DefaultGripper.

void relax ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Relaxes the gripper ( Does not apply any force to the gripper).

Reimplemented in DefaultGripper.
